name: Archeological Find
location: A claimed hex of the GMâ€™s choosing but not in the influence of a settlement
description: You hear that a well-preserved ruin in a remote reach of your kingdom may contain historical artifacts connected to people who lived in your land long ago. You can send a team of archaeologists to investigate.

criticalSuccess.msg: The site proves to be an ancient settlement that greatly predates the expansion into the region. Your people are delighted by the discovery. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Lose 1d4 Unrest</button>, and until the end of your next Kingdom turn, all Culture- and Economy-based skill checks gain a +2 circumstance bonus. If any of your settlements has a Museum, you put archaeological findings from this hex on display to the further delight of your citizens. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Unrest</button>

success.msg: The site proves to be remains of an old camp. The discovery is interesting but not particularly surprising. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="2">Lose 2 Unrest</button>

failure.msg: The site proves to be the remains of a relatively recent village abandoned during a previous attempt to settle the lands. Nothing particularly interesting is discovered.

criticalFailure.msg: You never hear from your archaeologists again. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Gain 1d4 Unrest</button> and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="decay" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Decay</button>. You can try to investigate this site again as a Region activity during the Activity phase of any Kingdom turn by attempting another Exploration check, but as the investigation has proven dangerous, the DC increases by 2.
